intent: Develop a strictly rule-governed composition where perceptual tension emerges from minimal means: fixed module, constrained palette, and deterministic spacing logic.
constraints: Single rule family: progressive interval expansion

researchTrail.title: Minimalism Movement Overview | TheArtStory
takeaways: Minimalism rejects biographical or emotional gesture in favor of objecthood and anonymity.
Repetition, modularity, and industrial/prefabricated logic are foundational methods.
Meaning is carried through spatial relation, scale, and direct viewer encounter rather than symbolism.
The movement challenged strict painting/sculpture boundaries under a 'what you see is what you see' ethos.

iterations.summary: Uniform spacing grid bars; stable but conceptually low-pressure.
Introduced interval growth; stronger directionality but center overcrowded.
Reduced object count and shifted mass rightward; asymmetry improved.
Enforced object cap with expanded void field; strongest rule legibility.

selfCritique: System integrity is strong, but conceptual framing still risks reading as polished formalism. Next cycle should test rotational and aspect-ratio robustness to verify the rule-set is structurally meaningful, not stylistic.

finalOutput.title: Monotonic Interval Field
finalOutput.rationale: Final uses 14 rectilinear modules on a 12-column scaffold with deterministic interval expansion and a dominant upper-left void. It foregrounds visible procedure over ornament, aligning with Bill's systems-minimalist identity and growth axis.
